description: Non Material Amendment to planning permission 22/02905/FUL (Application under S73 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with condition 1 (Approved plans) of planning permission ref: 20/02495/FUL (Full planning application for the demolition of Surrey House, Multi Storey Car Park, Hippodrome and Bo Concept and the erection of 2(two) Office buildings [Use Class - E(g)(i)] Building A and Building B: Building A 9 storeys (22,144 (GEA) sqms) Building B 11 storeys (11,587 (GEA) sqms). The erection of a replacement multi storey car park of 354 spaces plus cycle parking (for use as a public car park at weekends) landscaping, public realm upgrades, servicing, pedestrian and vehicular access. This application is accompanied by an Environmental Statement) dated 02/12/2021. Variation to consist of revisions to the Car Park (Building C) to relocate and install louvres in the external envelope  within the buildings A and B.
decision_conditions: Before the use hereby permitted commences the applicant shall provide full written details of any discharge of air from the proposed kitchen and barista bar areas to the Local Planning Authority for their approval. The use shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved details  The details shall include, where applicable: (i) The extract fan, attenuators, anti-vibration mounts, high velocity cowl, filters, odour abatement and any other items of plant;(ii) The velocity of the air at final discharge and duct termination height and location(iii) The retention time of gases in the carbon filters (where applicable);(iv) A maintenance schedule;(v) A completion of an risk assessment of odour and demonstration of compliance with "Control of Odour and Noise from Commercial Kitchen Exhaust Systems" published by EMAQ+ dated September 2018, which replaced the previous Defra guidance, now withdrawn.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Before the use hereby permitted commences an acoustic report shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the rating level of any noise emitted from external louvres will be at least 5dBA lower than the existing background noise level during any normal mode of operation.  The noise levels shall be measured or predicted 1m externally to any window of a habitable room at the nearest residential facade.  Measurements and assessment shall be made according to British Standard 4142:2014. THe use shall only be operated in accordance with the approved details. Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.These details are required prior to commencement of development because the relevant works would take place at the beginning of the construction phase and the details are likely to affect the design of other elements of the scheme.
